meanings.definition: The position or role of a solicitor.
meanings.sent1: In our town, many aspire to prestigious solicitorships.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue solicitorships after completing law school.
meanings.sent3: The competition for top solicitorships was fierce, but he managed to secure a position.
meanings.sent4: To him, solicitorships were like keys to unlocking justice for those in need.
meanings.sent5: The responsibilities that come with solicitorships are both challenging and rewarding.

meanings.definition: The practice or business of a solicitor.
meanings.sent1: Her family has been in solicitorships for generations.
meanings.sent2: The firm specializes in various solicitorships, from real estate to criminal law.
meanings.sent3: When asked about his job, he jokingly said he was knee-deep in solicitorships.
meanings.sent4: The world of solicitorships is a complex web of legal expertise and client relations.
meanings.sent5: She found success by approaching solicitorships with dedication and integrity.
